name: Tales of a Junktown Jerky Vendor
name_plural: Tales of a Junktown Jerky Vendor
description: A book of stories from a fictional apocalyptic town. In between the anecdotes are some actually good tips on running a business, and some recipes for 'iguana'...

name: Boy Scout's Handbook
description: The Boy Scout's handbook, 2077 edition. Contains information useful in wilderness survival, including a few melee weapons, and the 'Survival Quesidilla'!

name: Gun Runner's Ammo Specs
description: A design document full of the basic Gun Runner loads of ammunition. This was released to the general public shortly before the Cataclysm,as a publicity stunt. Now you too can make bullets like a professional!

name: The Modern Gunsmith
description: A book of DIY weapon projects, endorsed by the government to help every citizen be knowledgable 'at a moments notice.'

name: AntAgonizer Comic
description: The AntAgonizer, an antihero comic from Hubris Comics. The authors worked tirelessly to keep designs as realistically as possible.

name: Grognak Comic
description: Grognak the Barbarian and the Jungle of the Bat Babies. Violent, brutal, and... utterly fun.

name: Hell's Chain Gang Comic
description: Hell's Chain Gang, by Hubris Comics. Full of improvised weapons based off those real prisoners used.

name: Silver Shroud Comic
description: When evil walks the streets of Boston, one man lurks in the shadows. Shielding the innocent. Judging the guilty. That guardian is... the Silver Shroud! Published by Hubris Comics.

name: Manta-Man Comic
description: A comic about a hero with oceanic superpowers and swimming skill. Criminally underrated to some, to others absolutely horrible

name: Dean's Electronics
description: A popular book from the pre-cataclysm days, this book contains several guides to nuclear powered gadgets, all without the use of a transistor! Sponsored by Radiation King.

name: Dean's Electronics: Vault Boy Edition
description: A popular book from the pre-cataclysm days, this book contains several guides to nuclear powered gadgets, all without the use of a transistor! The limited Vault Boy edition has illustrations featuring everyone's favorite Vault Dweller, and a couple bonus recipes for the Vault Mechanics out there.

name: Total Hack
description: Everything you need to know about robots, turrets, and even computers.
This book doesn't feel right... It seems to be a holy book, but you can't pronounce most of the words... Its surprisingly heavy.
